urls.title: What do you think of this? - Mark Avery
urls.description: Who doesn’ t love a turtle? asks the headline. Quite a few to judge from the reception this piece got on social media. Two lads planning to make money out of captive breeding reptiles and amphibians and with an ambition to reintroduce herptiles to the UK – quite a few of them. When I was their age I didn’ t have this much gumption! All reintroductions need to be carefully thought through of course – and there are laws involved too. But the thing that strikes me about this is that it is another of a

text: @jezsquires @janeyh41 @MarkAvery @patrick_barkham @BenGoldsmith @gow_derek @NaturalEngland @ChrisGPackham @GeorgeMonbiot @ARC_Bytes @froglifers @PondRiverStream @EnvAgency @WWTconservation @WildlifeTrusts @angling_times @NFUtweets @CLAtweets Not European pond turtles. Different prey preferences and population structure.

@janeyh41 @MarkAvery @CelticReptile @patrick_barkham @BenGoldsmith @gow_derek @NaturalEngland @ChrisGPackham @GeorgeMonbiot @ARC_Bytes @froglifers @PondRiverStream @EnvAgency @WWTconservation @WildlifeTrusts @angling_times @NFUtweets @CLAtweets Terrapins would destroy a native pond or stream as they have no natural predators in UK and wiped out many localised populations of native freshwater snails, invertebrates, crayfish and freshwater mussels. So yes. They destroy environments.

RT @kernowbeaver: @SteveCJjones @MarkAvery @CelticReptile @patrick_barkham @BenGoldsmith @gow_derek @NaturalEngland @ChrisGPackham @GeorgeM…

@kernowbeaver @MarkAvery @CelticReptile @patrick_barkham @BenGoldsmith @gow_derek @NaturalEngland @ChrisGPackham @GeorgeMonbiot @ARC_Bytes @froglifers @PondRiverStream @EnvAgency @WWTconservation @WildlifeTrusts @angling_times @NFUtweets @CLAtweets For those particular feasibility studies, constraints in supply of animals are such that working the studies up isn't delaying anything. Frankly I think beavers should be released into many river systems now, without further study or delay.

@kernowbeaver @MarkAvery @CelticReptile @patrick_barkham @BenGoldsmith @gow_derek @NaturalEngland @ChrisGPackham @GeorgeMonbiot @ARC_Bytes @froglifers @PondRiverStream @EnvAgency @WWTconservation @WildlifeTrusts @angling_times @NFUtweets @CLAtweets Don't worry Chris, I've been worn down by two decades of species action planning and flood management consenting - much to no good effect! But I'm also working up a couple of species reintroduction feasibility studies and so can see their value, sort of.
RT @SouthseaCS: £20K match funding from @EnvAgencySE will enable us to install tide pools as part of the @SouthseaCS to provide a habitat f…

@SteveCJjones @MarkAvery @CelticReptile @patrick_barkham @BenGoldsmith @gow_derek @NaturalEngland @ChrisGPackham @GeorgeMonbiot @ARC_Bytes @froglifers @PondRiverStream @EnvAgency @WWTconservation @WildlifeTrusts @angling_times @NFUtweets @CLAtweets I think we can choose to be super cautious and 'led by the science' or we can choose life. This is not described as an emergency for nothing.

Ace to be part of a great team effort & a rare treat to be working in the sun today! This has been a super-challeging #nfm build project in a remote location. At times the winter weather threw everything it had at us. Really proud of this project for @SCRiversTrust @EnvAgencyNW https://t.co/bEDRgijK6T

text: @BenGoldsmith @MarkAvery @CelticReptile @patrick_barkham @NaturalEngland @ChrisGPackham @GeorgeMonbiot @ARC_Bytes @froglifers @PondRiverStream @EnvAgency @WWTconservation @WildlifeTrusts @angling_times @NFUtweets @CLAtweets The system we have forged for nature recovery in Britain is wheezing along like an old robin reliant it’s inadequate and profoundly pointless. text: @janeyh41 @MarkAvery @CelticReptile @patrick_barkham @BenGoldsmith @gow_derek @NaturalEngland @ChrisGPackham @GeorgeMonbiot @ARC_Bytes @froglifers @PondRiverStream @EnvAgency @WWTconservation @WildlifeTrusts @angling_times @NFUtweets @CLAtweets I think you are referring to North American terrapins, popularised by the TMNT cartoons and films in the 90s. Parents bought them as pets for kids and when they grew to the size of a plate chucked them out and they destroyed local lakes/ponds indigenous species.

domain.name: Interests and Hobbies Category
domain.description: A grouping of interests and hobbies entities, like Novelty Food or Destinations

RT @MarkAvery: What do you think of this? https://t.co/vDHUGfFSLa

@CelticReptile @patrick_barkham @BenGoldsmith @gow_derek @NaturalEngland…

urls.title: What do you think of this? - Mark Avery
urls.description: Who doesn’ t love a turtle? asks the headline. Quite a few to judge from the reception this piece got on social media. Two lads planning to make money out of captive breeding reptiles and amphibians and with an ambition to reintroduce herptiles to the UK – quite a few of them. When I was their age I didn’ t have this much gumption! All reintroductions need to be carefully thought through of course – and there are laws involved too. But the thing that strikes me about this is that it is another of a

text: @janeyh41 @gow_derek @MarkAvery @patrick_barkham @BenGoldsmith @NaturalEngland @ChrisGPackham @GeorgeMonbiot @ARC_Bytes @froglifers @PondRiverStream @EnvAgency @WWTconservation @WildlifeTrusts @angling_times @NFUtweets @CLAtweets Yes they have been caught.

@gow_derek @MarkAvery @CelticReptile @patrick_barkham @BenGoldsmith @NaturalEngland @ChrisGPackham @GeorgeMonbiot @ARC_Bytes @froglifers @PondRiverStream @EnvAgency @WWTconservation @WildlifeTrusts @angling_times @NFUtweets @CLAtweets I heard this from someone who was involved in catching them but I couldn't provide you with evidence I'm afraid.

@gow_derek @janeyh41 @MarkAvery @patrick_barkham @BenGoldsmith @NaturalEngland @ChrisGPackham @GeorgeMonbiot @ARC_Bytes @froglifers @PondRiverStream @EnvAgency @WWTconservation @WildlifeTrusts @angling_times @NFUtweets @CLAtweets I've seen the site. Not European. American. We do not support this, would only reintroduce lost natives (agile frog, Moor frog, pond turtle)

@MarkAvery @patrick_barkham @BenGoldsmith @gow_derek @NaturalEngland @ChrisGPackham @GeorgeMonbiot @ARC_Bytes @froglifers @PondRiverStream @EnvAgency @WWTconservation @WildlifeTrusts @angling_times @NFUtweets @CLAtweets Thanks Mark!

RT @EnvAgency: Would you know what to do if a flood was forecast in your area? 

Now’s the best time to get planning to avoid damage to you…
